p: I am so sorry to hear about Lloyd Mitchell. What was the final word from him?
The time is here now, for you & me to figure what wre our mutual financial obligations & govern all undertakings accordingly. I want to help, and that is understood.

In the long run, it would be best & most economical for me to trade the Chrysler in on a trouble-free new car, in view of the situation explained in a letter today to Maxine. But, I will & want to do what you & I decide is best for now, & in keeping with the situation we are in. Somehow, we must make my job help us all.

I fully expect a bonus on this months business. What a Godsend it would be. Last month I was 2nd highest salesman of hte organization. Not bad, considering the superior opportunities some of the others have. Is it?
I'm going to try now to find a room & board set-up where I can live mroe reasonably.
